intro: Manettia cephalophora, commonly known as the red-veined stinging nettle, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many species with stinging hairs. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with prominent red veins and produces small, greenish flowers in clusters. Its stinging hairs, which contain irritants, are a notable botanical characteristic. It is often found in moist, shaded areas and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
